member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType
member.summary: An enum representing the different types of code vulnerabilities that can be detected by Copilot.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown vulnerability type. Used as the default when the server returns a type that is not recognized by the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.PathInjection
member.summary: Unvalidated input in path value creation risks unintended file/directory access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.SqlInjection
member.summary: Unchecked input in database commands can alter intended queries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.CodeInjection
member.summary: Treating external input as code without proper validation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.CommandLineInjection
member.summary: Allowing user input in system calls without proper escaping can allow arbitrary command execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.StackTraceExposure
member.summary: Error messages or stack traces can reveal sensitive details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.IncompleteUrlSubstringSanitization
member.summary: Unvalidated input in URLs risks syntax or behavior modification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.FlaskDebug
member.summary: Debug mode in Flask production allows arbitrary code execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ClearTextLogging
member.summary: Logging sensitive info like passwords by exposing it in clear text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.IncompleteHostnameRegularExpression
member.summary: Regular expression may match unexpected hostnames.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ServerSideUnvalidatedUrlRedirection
member.summary: Unvalidated URL redirection from a remote source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ClientSideUnvalidatedUrlRedirection
member.summary: Allowing unvalidated redirection based on user-specified URLs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.UnvalidatedUrlRedirection
member.summary: Unvalidated URL redirection from a remote source. TODO: differentiate from ServerSideUnvalidatedUrlRedirection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.WeakCryptographicAlgorithm
member.summary: Using weak encryption or hashing algorithms poses security risks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.WeakCryptographicKey
member.summary: Using weak encryption or hashing algorithms poses security risks. TODO: Differentiate from WeakCryptographicAlgorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ServerSideRequestForgery
member.summary: Unvalidated input in HTTP requests may lead to SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) attacks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.BindSocketToAllInterfaces
member.summary: Binding to all network interfaces may expose traffic interception.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ReflectedCrossSiteScripting
member.summary: Adding unvalidated user input to HTTP responses invites XSS.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ClearTextStorageFile
member.summary: Storing sensitive data like passwords in clear text is insecure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ClearTextStorageSensitiveData
member.summary: Storing sensitive data like passwords in clear text is insecure. TODO: Differentiate from ClearTextStorageFile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.TarSlip
member.summary: Extracting tar archives without validation may lead to files being unexpectedly overwritten.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.HardcodedCredentials
member.summary: Embedding credentials in source code risks unauthorized access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.InsecureRandomness
member.summary: Weak random number generation can compromise security.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.InsufficientPasswordHash
member.summary: Weak hashing algorithms for passwords poses security risks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.OverlyPermissiveFile
member.summary: Permissions for files should be kept as strict as possible to prevent unintended access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.RegularExpressionInjection
member.summary: Unvalidated user input used in regular expressions can lead to arbitrary code execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.SizeOfPointer
member.summary: Incorrect usage of the sizeof operator on a pointer can lead to memory corruption or buffer overflow vulnerabilities.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotCodeVulnerabilityType.ConditionallyUninitializedVariable
member.summary: Using a variable that may not have been initialized can lead to unpredictable behavior or crashes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotMention
member.summary: Base class for mentions in request and response content.

remarks.para: This is the base class for the various types of mentionables: 1. Agents 2. Context 3. Commands 4. Variables
Mentionables share a few characteristics: 1. They all have a leading syntax character. 2. They accept inputs.

If the parsed mention type has a name, it will be in the first input. Mentions have two phases: Parsed and Queried. Parsing does not determine the presence of the mentioned item, only its syntax. Querying is implemented internally and takes a variety of paths to display or determine presence before invocation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ICopilotBatchContextReducer
member.summary: Represents a contract for batch reducing contexts. "/>.
member.remarks: Implement this interface to provide custom logic for reducing a set of contexts in batch. This is typically used in scenarios where multiple contexts need to be processed together to produce a more concise or relevant set of contexts. This interface is an optional extension to a context reducer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ICopilotBatchContextReducer.ReduceAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotContext},Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotReductionOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Provides the ability to reduce a set of contexts in batch.
member.param: The set of to reduce.
Options for how to perform the reduction.
A cancellation token.
member.returns: A new set of containing reduced .

remarks.para: In order to properly represent the actual contexts that were used to the user, new context objects must be generated instead of simply returning new prompts.

The parameter provides options for guiding the reduction process: - : Represents the number of tokens available for the reduction process. This helps ensure that the reduced context fits within the allowed token limit. - : Represents the language model used for the request. Different models may have different tokenization strategies and limits, so knowing the model helps tailor the reduction process. - : Represents the original user request, providing additional context or guidance for how the reduction should be performed. This can include user preferences or specific parts of the context that should be prioritized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.SymbolKind
member.summary: Describes the kind of a from the customer's codebase.
member.remarks:
Copied from GitHub Blackbird's Symbol Extractor, which largely does this same sort of consolidation of diverse concepts into a single language agnostic vocabulary.
https://github.com/github/symbol-extraction/blob/main/crates/lib/src/lib.rs#L57C1-L89C1
I have intentionally retained names and members (sometimes commented out) to match symbol-extraction crate to make for an easier import of additional Tree-Sitter queries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.InheritanceFormatter`1.CreateSerializeDelegatePair(System.Type)
member.summary: Generate Serialize and Deserialize delegates.
member.param: The type to serialize/deserialize.
member.exception: is not assignable from .

remarks.para: While we can call and get a formatter typed to our given , it only returns . We still need a way to call it, so this generates a delegate for which you can pass in and it will cast it and then call the strongly typed Serialize/Deserialize for the actual value type.

This is done with expressions and a compile to save the reflection costs we'd otherwise need to incur for every serialize/deserialize of the type, which then necessitates storing the compiled pair in .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ICopilotTraitProvider
member.summary: Represents a provider for Copilot traits.
member.remarks:
Traits are characteristics or properties specific to a domain within the workspace. They are obtained from trait providers, which in turn obtain them from available trait sources within a workspace. For more details on traits, refer to the class.
To register a trait provider, use the method from the interface.
If the trait provider needs to provide workspace traits, it should be registered against context type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.ICopilotTraitProvider.GetTraitsAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.CopilotContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves the traits for a given .
member.param: The context to obtain traits for.
The cancellation token.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the list of Copilot traits.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.SerializedObject
member.summary: A is a wrapper around any MessagePack-serializable object which defers deserialization until requested. This allows serialized objects to be passed around in a type-agnostic way without the need to deserialize them until they are actually needed. This enables extensions to use custom types in Copilot that can be safely serialized without Copilot needing access to the assembly that defines the type. The types can be serialized in the extension before being sent to Copilot and then deserialized back in the extension after retrieving from Copilot.
member.remarks: Objects stored inside a should not be mutated after the is created since the exact timing of the serialization (and thus the snapshot of object contents) is not controlled by the caller.

member.name: P:JsonSchemaMapper.JsonSchemaMapperConfiguration.TreatNullObliviousAsNonNullable
member.summary: Determines whether non-nullable schemas should be generated for null oblivious reference types.
member.remarks: Defaults to . Due to restrictions in the run-time representation of nullable reference types most occurrences are null oblivious and are treated as nullable by the serializer. A notable exception to that rule are nullability annotations of field, property and constructor parameters which are represented in the contract metadata.
